intro: Tarenna calcarea, commonly known as the limestone tarenna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, simple leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky, limestone-rich soils and is often found in dry, forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
